description:
This is a 2-panel mosaic of Andromeda which I took from 3 different locations in two states and it is one of my most extensive projects to date. I started this from a local Bortle 2 Star Party which was hastily organized at the end of August where I captured Luminance, captured the RGB and Ha (7nm) from my Bortle 4 home, and finally ended the project with another night of Luminance at the OkieTex Star Party in late September. My primary motivation in shooting this as a mosaic was avoidance of yet another generic diagonal M31 image - I think giving the galaxy some framing on all sides just looks better.

Challenges associated with this project can be found by following the attached link to my website Astronewton.com, but I will say here that, as with every other new imaging project, I learned a lot. Unfortunately my experimentation in new techniques led to an extensive delay between image capture and releasing this final image.

Pre-Processing:
 - Darks & Flats Calibration, Cosmic Correction
 - Subframe Selection & Local Normalization
 - Star Align of all channels to the best Ha frame of each panel
 - 2x Drizzle Integration

Housekeeping:
 - Common Crop per panel
 - Combined into Mosaic per Light Vortex Tutorials page
 - Second crop
 - DBE for each channel
 - RGB Combine
 - Photometric Color Calibration
 - HDR combine of 240s, 120s into Master Light channel (also used Ha image for finer core detail)
 
Ha+R & L:
 - Copied Ha image, ran STF stretch
 - Starnet to remove stars, creation of Star Mask
 - Erosion and removal of stars on Linear Ha image
 - Isolation of Ha from Red Continuum, addition to Red channel using PixelMath
 - Background Neutralization of HaRGB
 - Same process for adding isolated Hydrogen to Luminance master

Main Processing:
 - HSV Repair on HaRGB
 - TGVD, MMT noise reduction (Jon Rista method) on HaRGB, L
 - SCNR for removing excessive green

Non-Linear:
 - ArcSinH for L, HaRGB
 - Histogram Transformation to match Histogram peaks
 - LRGB Combine

Fine Tuning, or quite literally about 100 varying Curves, HDRMT, Histogram changes to correct:
 - Addition of HDR detail into the brighter core using dust lane mask to preserve core luminosity)
 - Masked brightening of larger pixel scale dust (per Inside PixInsight book)
 - Color correction to "cool" Blue tones, turn pinkish Ha highlights more Red, and careful increase of color
 - Finally, MT for star reduction
title: The Andromeda Galaxy [LHARGB]
